profile_positions.description:
2006 - Member of research team of the Overseas Development Institute in Londen for the European Commission and Papua New Guinea Government into options for the Papua New Guinean forest sector. 

2005 - Evaluation of experiences with community-based conservation in Papua New Guinea for the Nature Conservancy and World Wildlife Fund International.

2003 -Team member of the DGIS-LNV Identification mission designing the Netherlands contribution to the Asia Forest Partnership in Indonesia and Malaysia.

2002 - Teamleader of the Mid Term Review of the GEF/UNDP funded Upper Mustang Biodiversity Conservation Project, Nepal. 

2000 - Policy and Planning Needs Assessment for the Milne Bay Marine Integrated Conservation and Development Project in Papua New Guinea executed by Conservation International and the UNDP with GEF funding.

1999 - Report on the world-wide experiences with community-based sustainable forestry projects for the Interchurch Organisation for Development Co-operation (ICCO), the Netherlands.

1998 - Internal evaluation of the Office for Back Donor Relations within the Interchurch Organisation for Development Co-operation (ICCO), the Netherlands.

1998 - Internal evaluation of the involvement of the Interchurch Organisation for Development Co-operation (ICCO) in the SWIFT Eco-timber project in the Solomons Islands and its marketing enterprise SWIFT Hout BV in the Netherlands.

1997 - Member of the Netherlands Ministry of Foreign Affairs (BZ/OS) and Interchurch Organisation for Development Co-operation (ICCO) Evaluation of the Pacific Heritage Foundation eco-forestry project in Rabaul, Papua New Guinea.

1995 - Part-time lecturer at the Department of Anthropology at the University of Papua New Guinea in the subjects of Rural Development Sociology and Economic Anthropology.

1994 - Assessment of the level of biodiversity conservation related expenditure in Papua New Guinea for the UNDP/ACRE Papua New Guinea Country Biodiversity Study.

company.name: Ministry of Agriculture, Nature and Food Quality - Nature Department - The Netherlands

profile_positions.company: Ministry of Agriculture, Nature and Food Quality - Nature Department - The Netherlands
profile_positions.description:
Responsible for formulating Netherlands international forest and biodiversity policy with a focus on developing the EU FLEGT action plan against illegal logging and related trade. Within the UN framework active in the Convention on Biological Diversity (CBD), the International Tropical Timber Organisation (ITTO), the UN Forum on Forests (UNFF), the Food and Agricultural Organisation (FAO) and the Convention on International Trade in Endangered Species (CITES). Bilateral work focused on Malaysia and Indonesia in the context of the EU FLEGT action plan against illegal logging, ITTO project support and the Asia Forest Partnership. 

Policy and financial support to i) private sector and business-to-business initiatives to combat illegal logging and related trade, ii) non-governmental organisations aiming to improve forest management and biodiversity conservation in tropical production forests and iii) land-use policy in relation to the growing demand for food, fibre and fodder. 

Until May 2002 secretary to the interdepartmental working group organising the Dutch hosting of the Sixth Conference of Parties to the Convention on Biological Diversity in The Hague in April 2002.  Since 2004 member of the Netherlands negotiating team for the recently concluded International Tropical Timber Agreement 2006. From 2006 onwards (Vice)-Chairman of the Committee on Reforestation and Forest Management of the International Tropical Timber Council. In 2006 one of the authors of the 2007-2010 Cabinet paper on Netherlands International Biodiversity Policy.
profile_positions.title: Senior policy adviser
